text: Nemesia floribunda is an erect annual herb that is native to South Africa, but has naturalized elsewhere. == Description == Nemesia floribunda grows to a height of around . Its flowers are in diameter, and are white, with a pale yellow throat. == Taxonomy == Nemesia floribunda was described by the German botanist Johann Georg Christian Lehmann, but was originally discovered and collected by Christian Friedrich Ecklon. == Distribution == Nemesia floribunda is native to South Africa, but has naturalized in New Zealand. == References == == External links == * * Category:Flora of South Africa Category:Flora of New Zealand Category:Plants described in 1836
title: Nemesia floribunda
